column2: Spanish pronunciation: [talaˈɣante]) is one of six provinces of the Santiago Metropolitan Region in central Chile. The capital is the city of Talagante
column3: located approximately 35 km (22 mi) southwest of the national capital of Santiago. The most northeastern part of the province is included in the Santiago conurbation.

column2: Talagante is a second-level administrative division of Chile
column3: governed by a provincial governor who is appointed by the president.

column1: The province comprises five communes (Spanish: comunas)
column2: each governed by a municipality consisting of an alcalde and municipal council:

column1: The province spans an area of 582.3 square kilometres (582 km2)
column2: the smallest in the Santiago Metropolitan Region. According to the 2002 census
column3: Talagante was the fourth most populous province in the region with a total population of 188
